headline.main: Human Rights on Trial in Egypt as NGO Funding Case Revived
headline.print_headline: Human Rights on Trial in Egypt as NGO Funding Case Revived

docs.snippet: Egypt has launched a new crackdown on human rights groups, questioning staff and ordering asset freezes over accusations they took foreign funding to destabilize the country after the 2011 uprising that ended Hosni Mubarak's 30-year rule....
docs.lead_paragraph: Egypt has launched a new crackdown on human rights groups, questioning staff and ordering asset freezes over accusations they took foreign funding to destabilize the country after the 2011 uprising that ended Hosni Mubarak's 30-year rule.

docs.snippet: At the aptly named Planete Chocolat, the shelves are laden with enticing Easter treasures for shoppers: bunnies with bows, pastel-wrapped eggs and elegant boxes of pralines....

headline.main: Sanders Wins Democratic Presidential Caucuses in Hawaii

docs.lead_paragraph: Bernie Sanders wins the Democratic presidential caucuses in Hawaii, his third win over front-runner Hillary Clinton in three states holding party caucuses on Saturday.

headline.main: Myanmar Army Reasserts Its Key Political Role Ahead of Transition

headline.main: Leonard Freed’s Photos of Postwar Jewish Life in Amsterdam
